page.title: 07WILDLIFE ON ARRAN
page.content: The herds of red deer on the hills, especially near the String Road, are an impressive sight. Many small mammals, foxes, stoats, weasels, mink and red squirrels can be seen in the area. For the bird watcher there are birds of prey on the crags, birds of the forest and field plus a great number and variety of seabirds. Herons, mallards, eider together with smaller shore birds are sited near the rocks where colonies of grey and common seals bask while nearby gannets display their spectacular diving technique. Wild flowers of many species border the hedgerows, wild irises grow by the sea and the purple heather clothes the hills in summer. {BRODICK COUNTRY PARK}where there is a Ranger's Centre attracts many visitors each year.
